column4: does anyone know how to dual boot windows 7 and ubuntu with ubuntu installed first?
What's your partition layout?
What is your partitioning scheme?  Or are you an end user that doesn't understand linux much?

Basically, in order to install ubuntu, or any linux distro, and have it work with Windows, you must either have a grub boot partition, or you must install grub on your ubuntu partition, and copy the boot partition into a file on the windows drive.
right now I only have 1 hard drive formatted, and it has Ubuntu on an ext4 partition, I am planning to install windows 7 on another drive, and have 1 more drive for backup
Oh, well that shouldn't be a problem then.  Which disk is your primary disk?
What won't boot anymore?
Yeah, the boot order in the bios.  Does grub come with a menu then?
the Ubuntu drive is first, naturally, and my first 2 attempts have been with windows first, they failed miserably
I have a grub config like http://pastebin.com/d2a6d3fec
Does your grub config for Windows look anything like that?  And, did grub come up with the menu when you boot?
oh! of course, I used the default setting from the ubuntu installation
Oh, my grub config wasn't made by ubuntu, I made it, so I don't know what ubuntu would do during install.  So, it's important that I know it's actually the same.
stupid me didn't look at what the install generated
Do you get some errors?  Is it just hanging on you?  What do you see on the screen if it's hanging?
is what hanging?
hang as in not respond, like a dead man hanging from a noose.
I know what hang is, I was referring to what you asked was hanging?
oh, is the boot sequence hanging somewhere?
and where, and what is displayed, etc.
I thought you said you were having some problems with it booting?
You mentioned it not booting anymore if you add Windows 7 to the list.  So I assumed you meant you had attempted a Windows 7 installation before.
Okay, I'm a bit confused then.  What is not booting, when you add Windows 7 to the list?  Is grub not starting up?  Is ubuntu not starting up?
you ther?
